attributes.action: Force Theresa May to step down as Prime Minister.
attributes.additional_details:
As Johnson put it in his resignation letter:

The British government has spent decades arguing against this or that EU directive, on the grounds that it was too burdensome or ill-thought out. We are now in the ludicrous position of asserting that we must accept huge amounts of precisely such EU law, without changing an iota, because it is essential for our economic health - and when we no longer have any ability to inﬂuence these laws as they are made.
attributes.background:
Thursday 23 June, 2016 the British people voted to LEAVE the EU. Theresa May is a Remainer and proved time and again that she has no intention of fulfilling the Tory manifesto of delivering a true Brexit.
She has lied to the people, slyly trying to undermine us, treating us like idiots. She must go

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers, including the Prime Minister, to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence.

We used to accept petitions that called for a vote of no confidence. However, the Petitions Committee can’t schedule votes of no confidence. This was often frustrating and disappointing for petitioners. 

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that. 
Petitions calling for action on policy are more likely to be an effective way of achieving the change you want.
